briefdescription.para: The maximum volume of water that can be diverted through the quarry.
The volume of water diverted through the quarry.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, const int id, const vector< Catchment *> &catchments, const double capacity, const double max_treatment_capacity, EvaporationSeries &evaporation_series, DataSeries *storage_area_curve, double max_diversion)
memberdef.name: Quarry

briefdescription.para: Constructs a Quarry object. This function initializes a quarry reservoir with specified parameters such as name, ID, catchments, capacity, treatment capacity, evaporation data, and more.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the quarry as a C-style string.
The unique identifier of the quarry as an integer.
A vector of pointers to Catchment objects representing the catchments linked to the quarry.
The total storage capacity of the quarry in cubic units.
The maximum treatment capacity of the quarry.
A reference to an EvaporationSeries object containing evaporation data for the quarry.
A pointer to a DataSeries object defining the relationship between storage and surface area of the quarry. Can be null.
The maximum diversion flow rate allowed from the quarry.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, const int id, const vector< Catchment *> &catchments, const double capacity, const double max_treatment_capacity, EvaporationSeries &evaporation_series, DataSeries *storage_area_curve, const vector< double > &construction_time_range, double permitting_period, Bond &bond, double max_diversion)
memberdef.name: Quarry

briefdescription.para: Constructs a Quarry object. This function initializes a quarry reservoir with specified parameters such as name, ID, catchments, capacity, treatment capacity, evaporation data. It also includes additional parameters that define the construction timeline, and financial bond details.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the quarry as a C-style string.
The unique identifier of the quarry as an integer.
A vector of pointers to Catchment objects representing the catchments linked to the quarry.
The total storage capacity of the quarry in cubic units.
The maximum treatment capacity of the quarry.
A reference to an EvaporationSeries object containing evaporation data for the quarry.
A pointer to a DataSeries object defining the relationship between storage and surface area of the quarry. Can be null.
A vector of doubles representing the start and end times of the quarry's construction period.
The permitting period for the quarry in time units.
A reference to a Bond object representing the financial bond associated with the quarry.
The maximum diversion flow rate allowed from the quarry.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, const int id, const vector< Catchment *> &catchments, const double capacity, const double max_treatment_capacity, EvaporationSeries &evaporation_series, double storage_area, double max_diversion)
memberdef.name: Quarry

briefdescription.para: Constructs a Quarry object. This function initializes a quarry reservoir with specified parameters such as name, ID, catchments, capacity, treatment capacity, evaporation data. It specifies a fixed storage area instead of a storage area curve.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the quarry as a C-style string.
The unique identifier of the quarry as an integer.
A vector of pointers to Catchment objects representing the catchments linked to the quarry.
The total storage capacity of the quarry in cubic units.
The maximum treatment capacity of the quarry .
A reference to an EvaporationSeries object containing evaporation data for the quarry.
The surface area of the quarry in square units.
The maximum diversion flow rate allowed from the quarry.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, const int id, const vector< Catchment *> &catchments, const double capacity, const double max_treatment_capacity, EvaporationSeries &evaporation_series, double storage_area, const vector< double > &construction_time_range, double permitting_period, Bond &bond, double max_diversion)
memberdef.name: Quarry

briefdescription.para: Constructs a Quarry object. This function initializes a quarry reservoir with specified parameters such as name, ID, catchments, capacity, treatment capacity, evaporation data. It also includes additional parameters that define the construction timeline, and financial bond details. It specifies a fixed storage area instead of a storage area curve.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the quarry as a C-style string.
The unique identifier of the quarry as an integer.
A vector of pointers to Catchment objects representing the catchments linked to the quarry.
The total storage capacity of the quarry in cubic units.
The maximum treatment capacity of the quarry.
A reference to an EvaporationSeries object containing evaporation data for the quarry.
The surface area of the quarry in square units.
A vector of doubles representing the start and end times of the quarry's construction period.
The permitting period for the quarry in time units.
A reference to a Bond object representing the financial bond associated with the quarry.
The maximum diversion flow rate allowed from the quarry.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a Quarry object as a copy of an existing Quarry object, with an option to set a new maximum diversion rate by overriding the max diversion of the original Quarry object.

parameterdescription.para: A reference to the existing Quarry object to copy.
The maximum diversion flow rate allowed through the new quarry. This overrides the value from the copied Quarry object.

briefdescription.para: Overloads the assignment operator for the Quarry class, allowing one Quarry object to be assigned to another.

detaileddescription.para: This function copies the properties of an existing Quarry object, including the maximum diversion rate, to the current Quarry object.

parameterdescription.para: A reference to the existing Quarry object to copy.

simplesect.para: A reference to the current Quarry object after assignment.

detaileddescription.para: This function cleans up resources used by the Quarry object. Since the class does not dynamically allocate resources directly, the destructor relies on the base class (Reservoir) and standard cleanup mechanisms.

memberdef.argsstring: (int week, double upstream_source_inflow, double wastewater_inflow, vector< double > &demand_outflow) override
memberdef.name: applyContinuity

briefdescription.para: Applies the continuity equation to update the Quarry's inflows, outflows, and available volume based on weekly data.

detaileddescription.para: This function performs reservoir mass balance by using the total inflow, demand outflow, and updates the available volume and total outflow based on inflows from upstream sources, wastewater, combining them with catchment inflows. The function also ensures that the quarry maintains its capacity limits and adjusts outflows accordingly.

parameterdescription.para: The week number for which the continuity equation is applied.
The inflow from the upstream source in cubic units.
The inflow from wastewater in cubic units.
A vector representing the demand outflow for the week.

briefdescription.para: Sets the Quarry object to an online state.

detaileddescription.para: This function transitions the Quarry to an operational state by marking it as online. The available volume is initially set to NONE, simulating an empty reservoir that begins to fill as inflows occur.
